info.desc: Mark up the output from a computer program.

item.p: The style attribute takes a space-separated list of style hints. Processing tools should adjust their rendering according to those style hints they understand.
Typical values for the style attribute include:

td.p: Standard output from a running program
Standard error from a running program
The command prompt for an interactive shell

item.p: The output element, together with the input element, may be used to mark up the contents of a screen element, allowing processing tools to render them differently.
The output element can link to other pages or documents. See for more information.
The output element can have attributes from external namespaces. See for more information on external-namespace attributes on inline elements.

section.title: Comparison to DocBook
section.p: The output element is similar to the computeroutput element in DocBook. When necessary, the output element may be used with the style attribute "prompt" in place of DocBook's prompt element. In some cases, it may be appropriate to use the output element with the style attribute "error" in place of DocBook's errorname and errortext elements.
